Potassium and Calcium, so you'll grow strong
Scandium, Titanium, Vanadium
And Chromium and Manganese
This is the Periodic Table
Noble Gas is stable
Halogens and Alkali react aggressively
Each period we'll see new outer shells
While electrons are added moving to the right
Iron is the 26, then Cobalt
Nickel, coins you get
Copper, Zinc, and Gallium
Germanium and Arsenic
Selenium and Bromine film
While Krypton helps light up your room

And now asap science presents:
Elements of the periodic table!
There's....hydrogen and helium then lithium beryllium. Boron carbon everywhere and nitrogen all through the air. There's oxygen so you can breathe, and fluorine for your pretty teeth neon to light up the signs and sodium for salty times. Magnesium! Aluminium, silicon. Phosphorus! Then sulphur chlorine and argon. Potassium! And calcium so you'll grow strong! Scandium! Titanium, Vanadium and chromium and manganese! This is the periodic table, noble gas is stable! Hallogens and alkali react aggressively! Each period we'll see new outer shells while electrons are added moving to the right Iron is the 26th then colbalt, Nickel coins you get! Copper, zinc and gallium, germanium and arsenic! Selenium and bromine film while krypton helps light up your room Rubidium and strontium then yttrium, Zirconium... Niobium! Molybdenum, Technetium. Scandium, Titanium, Vanadium
And Chromium and Manganese

This is the Periodic Table
Noble Gas is stable
Halogens and Alkali react aggressively
Each period we'll see new outer shells
While electrons are added moving to the right

Iron is the 26, then Cobalt
Nickel, coins you get

Germanium and Arsenic

Selenium and Bromine film

There's Hydrogen and Helium
Then Lithium, Beryllium

Sodium for salty times

Magnesium, Aluminium, Silicon
Phosphorus, then Sulfur, Chlorine and Argon
Potassium, and Calcium so you'll grow strong
Scandium, Titanium, Vanadium and Chromium and Manganese

CHORUS
This is the Periodic Table
Noble gas is stable
Halogens and Alkali react agressively
Each period will see new outer shells
While electrons are added moving to the right

Iron is the 26th
Then Cobalt, Nickel coins you get
Copper, Zinc and Gallium
Germanium and Arsenic

Selenium and Bromine film
While Krypton helps light up your room
Rubidium and Strontium then Yttrium, Zirconium

Niobium, Molybdenum, Technetium
Ruthenium, Rhodium, Palladium
Silver-ware then Cadmium and Indium
Tin-cans, Antimony then Tellurium and Iodine and Xenon and then Caesium and...

Barium is 56 and this is where the table splits
Where Lanthanides have just begun
Lanthanum, Cerium and Praseodymium

Neodymium's next too
Promethium, then 62's
Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium and Terbium
Dysprosium, Holmium, Erbium, Thulium

Hafnium, Tantalum, Tungsten then we're on to
Rhenium, Osmium and Iridium
Platinum, Gold to make you rich till you grow old
Mercury to tell you when it's really cold

Thallium and Lead then Bismuth for your tummy
Polonium, Astatine would not be yummy
Radon, Francium will last a little time
Radium then Actinides at 89

REPEAT CHORUS

Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium
Uranium, Neptunium, Plutonium
Americium, Curium, Berkelium

Ununpentium, Livermorium

If my Chem teacher had been any good 30yrs ago, he would have sought out learning solutions like this - a 200yr-old piece of music that everybody recognises. As it was, pre-internet Chemistry class was more about memorising tables of numbers, properties, protons, electrons, neutrons, charges etc before you got to learn the interesting stuff. I was incapable of memorising anything past Nitrogen in order, so the curriculum was just not in my favour. I only passed because I was good at Algebra & because I promised never to study with him again.

AsapSCIENCE - The New Periodic Table Song

Artist: AsapSCIENCETranslations: Portuguese

English

The New Periodic Table Song

(And now AsapSCIENCE presents:

The Elements of the Periodic Table.)

 

There's Hydrogen and Helium

Then Lithium, Beryllium

Boron, Carbon everywhere

Nitrogen all through the air

 

With Oxygen so you can breathe

And Fluorine for your pretty teeth

Neon to light up the signs

Sodium for salty times

 

Magnesium, Aluminium, Silicon

Phosphorus, then Sulfur, Chlorine and Argon

Potassium, and Calcium so you'll grow strong

Scandium, Titanium, Vanadium and Chromium and Manganese

 

CHORUS

This is the Periodic Table

Noble gas is stable

Halogens and Alkali react agressively

Each period will see new outer shells

While electrons are added moving to the right

 

Iron is the 26th

Then Cobalt, Nickel coins you get

Copper, Zinc and Gallium

Germanium and Arsenic

 

Selenium and Bromine film

While Krypton helps light up your room

Rubidium and Strontium then Yttrium, Zirconium

 

Niobium, Molybdenum, Technetium

Ruthenium, Rhodium, Palladium

Silver-ware then Cadmium and Indium

Tin-cans, Antimony then Tellurium and Iodine and Xenon and then Caesium and...

 

Barium is 56 and this is where the table splits

Where Lanthanides have just begun

Lanthanum, Cerium and Praseodymium

 

Neodymium's next too

Promethium, then 62's

Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium and Terbium

Dysprosium, Holmium, Erbium, Thulium

Ytterbium, Lutetium

 

Hafnium, Tantalum, Tungsten then we're on to

Rhenium, Osmium and Iridium

Platinum, Gold to make you rich till you grow old

Mercury to tell you when it's really cold

 

Thallium and Lead then Bismuth for your tummy

Polonium, Astatine would not be yummy

Radon, Francium will last a little time

Radium then Actinides at 89

 

REPEAT CHORUS

 

Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium

Uranium, Neptunium, Plutonium

Americium, Curium, Berkelium

Californium, Einsteinium, Fermium

Mendelevium, Nobelium, Lawrencium

Rutherfordium, Dubnium, Seaborgium

Bohrium, Hassium then Meitnerium

Darmstadtium, Roentgenium, Copernicium

 

Ununtrium, Flerovium

Ununpentium, Livermorium

Ununseptium, Ununoctium

And then we're done!!

Antimony is a chemical element with symbol Sb (from Latin: stibium) and atomic number 51. A lustrous gray metalloid, it is found in nature mainly as the sulfide mineral stibnite (Sb2S3). Antimony compounds have been known since ancient times and were powdered for use as medicine and cosmetics, often known by the Arabic name, kohl.[4] Metallic antimony was also known, but it was erroneously identified as lead upon its discovery. In the West, it was first isolated by Vannoccio Biringuccio and described in 1540.

For some time, China has been the largest producer of antimony and its compounds, with most production coming from the Xikuangshan Mine in Hunan. The industrial methods for refining antimony are roasting and reduction with carbon or direct reduction of stibnite with iron.

The largest applications for metallic antimony is an alloy with lead and tin and the lead antimony plates in lead–acid batteries. Alloys of lead and tin with antimony have improved properties for solders, bullets, and plain bearings. Antimony compounds are prominent additives for chlorine and bromine-containing fire retardants found in many commercial and domestic products. An emerging application is the use of antimony in microelectronics.

This is the periodic table, noble gas is stable

Selenium then Bromine film whilst Krypton helps light up your room

Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium and Terbium

Radon, Francium will last a little time
Radium then Actinides at 89

Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium

LYRICS:

There's Hydrogen and Helium
Then Lithium, Beryllium
Boron, Carbon everywhere
Nitrogen all through the air

With Oxygen so you can breathe
And Fluorine for your pretty teeth
Neon to light up the signs
Sodium for salty times

Magnesium, Aluminium, Silicon
Phosphorus, then Sulfur, Chlorine and Argon
Potassium, and Calcium so you'll grow strong
Scandium, Titanium, Vanadium and Chromium and Manganese

CHORUS
This is the Periodic Table
Noble gas is stable
Halogens and Alkali react agressively
Each period will see new outer shells
While electrons are added moving to the right

Iron is the 26th
Then Cobalt, Nickel coins you get
Copper, Zinc and Gallium
Germanium and Arsenic

Selenium and Bromine film
While Krypton helps light up your room
Rubidium and Strontium then Yttrium, Zirconium

Niobium, Molybdenum, Technetium
Ruthenium, Rhodium, Palladium
Silver-ware then Cadmium and Indium
Tin-cans, Antimony then Tellurium and Iodine and Xenon and then Caesium and...

Barium is 56 and this is where the table splits
Where Lanthanides have just begun
Lanthanum, Cerium and Praseodymium

Neodymium's next too
Promethium, then 62's
Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium and Terbium
Dysprosium, Holmium, Erbium, Thulium
Ytterbium, Lutetium

Hafnium, Tantalum, Tungsten then we're on to
Rhenium, Osmium and Iridium
Platinum, Gold to make you rich till you grow old
Mercury to tell you when it's really cold

Thallium and Lead then Bismuth for your tummy
Polonium, Astatine would not be yummy
Radon, Francium will last a little time
Radium then Actinides at 89

REPEAT CHORUS

Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium
Uranium, Neptunium, Plutonium
Americium, Curium, Berkelium
Californium, Einsteinium, Fermium
Mendelevium, Nobelium, Lawrencium
Rutherfordium, Dubnium, Seaborgium
Bohrium, Hassium then Meitnerium
Darmstadtium, Roentgenium, Copernicium

Ununtrium, Flerovium
Ununpentium, Livermorium
Ununseptium, Ununoctium
And then we're done!!

Copper, Zinc and Gallium
Germanium and Arsenic

Promethium, then 62's
Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium and Terbium
Dysprosium, Holmium, Erbium, Thulium
Ytterbium, Lutetium

Radium then Actinides at 89

REPEAT CHORUS

Uranium, Neptunium, Plutonium

Ununseptium, Ununoctium
And then we're done!!

LYRICS:

There's Hydrogen and Helium
Then Lithium, Beryllium
Boron, Carbon everywhere
Nitrogen all through the air

With Oxygen so you can breathe
And Fluorine for your pretty teeth
Neon to light up the signs
Sodium for salty times

Magnesium, Aluminium, Silicon
Phosphorus, then Sulfur, Chlorine and Argon
Potassium, and Calcium so you'll grow strong
Scandium, Titanium, Vanadium and Chromium and Manganese

CHORUS
This is the Periodic Table
Noble gas is stable
Halogens and Alkali react agressively
Each period will see new outer shells
While electrons are added moving to the right

Iron is the 26th
Then Cobalt, Nickel coins you get
Copper, Zinc and Gallium
Germanium and Arsenic

Selenium and Bromine film
While Krypton helps light up your room
Rubidium and Strontium then Yttrium, Zirconium

Niobium, Molybdenum, Technetium
Ruthenium, Rhodium, Palladium
Silver-ware then Cadmium and Indium
Tin-cans, Antimony then Tellurium and Iodine and Xenon and then Caesium and...

Barium is 56 and this is where the table splits
Where Lanthanides have just begun
Lanthanum, Cerium and Praseodymium

Neodymium's next too
Promethium, then 62's
Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium and Terbium
Dysprosium, Holmium, Erbium, Thulium
Ytterbium, Lutetium

Hafnium, Tantalum, Tungsten then we're on to
Rhenium, Osmium and Iridium
Platinum, Gold to make you rich till you grow old
Mercury to tell you when it's really cold

Thallium and Lead then Bismuth for your tummy
Polonium, Astatine would not be yummy
Radon, Francium will last a little time
Radium then Actinides at 89

REPEAT CHORUS

Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium
Uranium, Neptunium, Plutonium
Americium, Curium, Berkelium
Californium, Einsteinium, Fermium
Mendelevium, Nobelium, Lawrencium
Rutherfordium, Dubnium, Seaborgium
Bohrium, Hassium then Meitnerium
Darmstadtium, Roentgenium, Copernicium

Ununtrium, Flerovium
Ununpentium, Livermorium
Ununseptium, Ununoctium
And then we're done!!

Avec l'oxygène afin que vous puissiez respirer, Et florine pour vos dents, Neon pour allumer les signes, Sodium pour les temps salés. Magnésium, aluminium, silicium. Phosphore! Puis soufre, chlore et argon. Potassium! Et le calcium si vous serez forte. Scandium! Le titane, le vanadium et le chrome, et le manganèse! C'est le tableau périodique, le gaz noble est stable, les halogènes et les alcalis réagissent agressivement! Chaque période, nous allons voir de nouvelles coquilles extérieures tandis que electons sont ajoutés, se déplaçant vers la droite. Le fer est le 26ème. Ensuite Cobalt, pièces de nickel vous obtenez. Cuivre, zinc et gallium. Germanium et Arsenic! Selenium et Bromine film, tandis que Krypton aide éclairer votre chambre. Rubidium et Strontium puis Yttrium, Zirconium, Nobium! Molybdène. Technetium. Ruthénium! Rhodium, Palladium. Argenterie, puis Cadmium et Indium Tin can! Antimoine! Le tellure, l'iode et le xénon, puis le césium et ... le baryum est 56, et c'est là que la table se sépare. Le lanthane, le cérium et le praséodyme. Le néodyme est à côté de Promethium alors 62. Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium et Terbium, Dysprosium, Holmium, Erbium, Thulium, Ytterbium, Lutétium. Hafnium, tantale, tungstène, puis nous sommes sur le rhénium, l'osmium et Iridium. Platine, Or pour vous rendre riche jusqu'à ce que vous vieillissez. Mercury, pour te dire quand il fait vraiment froid. Thallium! Et conduisez alors Bismuth pour votre ventre. Polonium! Astatine ne serait pas délicieux. Radon, Francium durera un peu de temps. Radium! Puis Actinides à 89! C'est le tableau périodique, le gaz noble est stable, les halogènes et les alcalis réagissent agressivement! Chaque période nous verrons de nouvelles coquilles extérieures, tandis que les électrons sont à droite. Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium. Uranium, Neptunium, Plutonium. Here's something to help everybody out there with exams on this:

There's Hydrogen and Helium Then Lithium, Beryllium Boron, Carbon everywhere Nitrogen all through the air With Oxygen so you can breathe And Fluorine for your pretty teeth Neon to light up the signs Sodium for salty times Magnesium, Aluminium, Silicon Phosphorus, then Sulfur, Chlorine and Argon Potassium, and Calcium so you'll grow strong Scandium, Titanium, Vanadium and Chromium and Manganese
 This is the Periodic Table Noble gas is stable Halogens and Alkali react aggressively Each period will see new outer shells While electrons are added moving to the right

 Iron is the 26th Then Cobalt, Nickel, coins you get Copper, Zinc and Gallium Germanium and Arsenic Selenium and Bromine film While Krypton helps light up your room Rubidium and Strontium then Yttrium, Zirconium Niobium, Molybdenum, Technetium Ruthenium, Rhodium, Palladium Silver-ware then Cadmium and Indium Tin-cans, Antimony then Tellurium and Iodine and Xenon and then Caesium and ...  Barium is 56 and this is where the table splits Where Lanthanides have just begun Lanthanum, Cerium and Praseodymium Neodymium's next too Promethium, then 62's  Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium and Terbium Dysprosium, Holmium, Erbium, Thulium Ytterbium, Lutetium Hafnium, Tantalum, Tungsten then we're on to Rhenium, Osmium and Iridium Platinum, Gold to make you rich till you grow old Mercury to tell you when it's really cold Thallium and Lead then Bismuth for your tummy Polonium, Astatine would not be yummy Radon, Francium will last a little time Radium then Actinides at 89  This is the Periodic Table Noble gas is stable Halogens and Alkali react aggressively Each period will see new outer shells While electrons are added moving to the right  Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium Uranium, Neptunium, Plutonium Americium, Curium, Berkelium Californium, Einsteinium, Fermium Mendelevium, Nobelium, Lawrencium Rutherfordium, Dubnium, Seaborgium Bohrium, Hassium then Meitnerium Darmstadtium, Roentgenium, Copernicium Ununtrium, Flerovium Ununpentium, Livermorium Ununseptium, Ununoctium
 And then we're done!

And now, ASAPSCIENCE presents the elements of the Periodic TABLE.
There’s Hydrogen then Helium, then Lithium, Beryllium, Boron, Carbon everywhere, Nitrogen all through the air. With Oxygen so you can breathe, And florine for your teeth, Neon to light up the signs, Sodium for salty times. Magnesium, Aluminum, Silicon. Phosphorus! Then Sulfur, Chlorine, and Argon. Potassium! And Calcium so you’ll grow strong. Scandium! Titanium, Vanadium, and Chromium, and Manganese! This is the Periodic table, Noble Gas is stable, Halogens and alkali react agressively! Each period we’ll see new outer shells while electons are added, moving to the right. Iron is the 26th. Then Cobalt, Nickel coins you get. Copper, Zinc, and Gallium. Germanium and Arsenic! Selenium and Bromine film, while Krypton helps light up your room. Rubidium and Strontium then Yttrium, Zirconium, Nobium! Molybdenum. Technetium. Ruthenium! Rhodium, Palladium. Silverware, then Cadmium and Indium Tin can! Antimony! The Tellurium, and Iodine and Xenon and then Caesium and… Barium is 56, and this is where the table splits. Lanthanum, cerium, and Praseodymium. Neodymium is next to Promethium then 62. Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium and Terbium, Dysprosium, Holmium, Erbium, Thulium, Ytterbium, Lutetium. Hafnium, Tantalum, Tungsten then we’re on to Rhenium, Osmium, and Iridium. Platinum, Gold to make you rich till’ you grow old. Mercury, to tell you when it’s really cold. Thallium! And Lead then Bismuth for your tummy. Polonium! Astatine would not be yummy. Radon, Francium will last a little time. Radium! Then Actinides at 89! This is the Periodic table, Noble Gas is stable, Halogens and Alkali react agressively! Each period we’ll see new outer shells, while electrons are to the right. Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium. Then Lithium, Beryllium
Boron, Carbon everywhere
Nitrogen all through the air

With Oxygen so you can breathe
And Fluorine for your pretty teeth
Neon to light up the signs
Sodium for salty times

Magnesium, Aluminium, Silicon
Phosphorus, then Sulfur, Chlorine and Argon
Potassium, and Calcium so you'll grow strong
Scandium, Titanium, Vanadium and Chromium and Manganese

CHORUS
This is the Periodic Table
Noble gas is stable
Halogens and Alkali react agressively
Each period will see new outer shells
While electrons are added moving to the right

Iron is the 26th
Then Cobalt, Nickel coins you get
Copper, Zinc and Gallium
Germanium and Arsenic

Selenium and Bromine film
While Krypton helps light up your room
Rubidium and Strontium then Yttrium, Zirconium

Niobium, Molybdenum, Technetium
Ruthenium, Rhodium, Palladium
Silver-ware then Cadmium and Indium
Tin-cans, Antimony then Tellurium and Iodine and Xenon and then Caesium and...

Barium is 56 and this is where the table splits
Where Lanthanides have just begun
Lanthanum, Cerium and Praseodymium

Neodymium's next too
Promethium, then 62's
Samarium, Europium, Gadolinium and Terbium
Dysprosium, Holmium, Erbium, Thulium
Ytterbium, Lutetium

Hafnium, Tantalum, Tungsten then we're on to
Rhenium, Osmium and Iridium
Platinum, Gold to make you rich till you grow old
Mercury to tell you when it's really cold

Thallium and Lead then Bismuth for your tummy
Polonium, Astatine would not be yummy
Radon, Francium will last a little time
Radium then Actinides at 89

REPEAT CHORUS

Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium
Uranium, Neptunium, Plutonium
Americium, Curium, Berkelium
Californium, Einsteinium, Fermium
Mendelevium, Nobelium, Lawrencium
Rutherfordium, Dubnium, Seaborgium
Bohrium, Hassium then Meitnerium
Darmstadtium, Roentgenium, Copernicium

Ununtrium, Flerovium
Ununpentium, Livermorium
Ununseptium, Ununoctium
And then we're done!!

So I'm to understand that a prominent change in this video was the removal of breasts as the illustration of "silicon."
